013package org.apache.juneau.encoders;
014
015import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.concurrent.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
027
028/**
029 * Represents the set of {@link Encoder encoders} keyed by codings.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
032 *
033 * Maintains a set of encoders and the codings that they can handle.
034 *
035 * <p>
036 * The {@link #getEncoderMatch(String)} and {@link #getEncoder(String)} methods are then used to find appropriate
037 * encoders for specific <c>Accept-Encoding</c> and <c>Content-Encoding</c> header values.
038 *
039 * <h5 class='topic'>Match ordering</h5>
040 *
041 * Encoders are matched against <c>Accept-Encoding</c> strings in the order they exist in this group.
042 *
043 * <p>
044 * Encoders are tried in the order they appear in the set.  The {@link Builder#add(Class...)}/{@link Builder#add(Encoder...)}
045 * methods prepend the values to the list to allow them the opportunity to override encoders already in the list.
046 *
047 * <p>
048 * For example, calling <code>groupBuilder.add(E1.<jk>class</jk>,E2.<jk>class</jk>).add(E3.<jk>class</jk>,
049 * E4.<jk>class</jk>)</code> will result in the order <c>E3, E4, E1, E2</c>.
050 *
051 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
052 * <p class='bjava'>
053 *    <jc>// Create an encoder group with support for gzip compression.</jc>
054 *    EncoderSet <jv>encoders</jv> = EncoderSet
055 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
056 *       .add(GzipEncoder.<jk>class</jk>)
057 *       .build();
058 *
059 *    <jc>// Should return "gzip"</jc>
060 *    String <jv>matchedCoding</jv> = <jv>encoders</jv>.findMatch(<js>"compress;q=1.0, gzip;q=0.8, identity;q=0.5, *;q=0"</js>);
061 *
062 *    <jc>// Get the encoder</jc>
063 *    Encoder <jv>encoder</jv> = <jv>encoders</jv>.getEncoder(<jv>matchedCoding</jv>);
064 * </p>
065 *
066 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
067 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
068 * </ul>
069 *
070 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
071 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerEncoders">Encoders</a>
072
073 * </ul>
074 */
075public class EncoderSet {
076
077   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
078   // Static
079   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
080
081   /**
082    * An identifier that the previous encoders in this group should be inherited.
083    * <p>
084    * Used by {@link Builder#set(Class...)}
085    */
086   public static abstract class Inherit extends Encoder {}
087
088   /**
089    * An identifier that the previous encoders in this group should not be inherited.
090    * <p>
091    * Used by {@link Builder#add(Class...)}
092    */
093   public static abstract class NoInherit extends Encoder {}
094
095   /**
096    * Static creator.
097    *
098    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
099    * @return A new builder for this object.
100    */
101   public static Builder create(BeanStore beanStore) {
102      return new Builder(beanStore);
103   }
104
105   /**
106    * Static creator.
107    *
108    * @return A new builder for this object.
109    */
110   public static Builder create() {
111      return new Builder(BeanStore.INSTANCE);
112   }
113
114   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
115   // Builder
116   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
117
118   /**
119    * Builder class.
120    */
121   @FluentSetters
122   public static class Builder extends BeanBuilder<EncoderSet> {
123      List<Object> entries;
124      Builder inheritFrom;
125
126      /**
127       * Constructor.
128       *
129       * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
130       */
131      protected Builder(BeanStore beanStore) {
132         super(EncoderSet.class, beanStore);
133         entries = Utils.list();
134      }
135
136      /**
137       * Copy constructor.
138       *
139       * @param copyFrom The builder being copied.
140       */
141      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
142         super(copyFrom);
143         entries = copyOf(copyFrom.entries);
144      }
145
146      @Override /* BeanBuilder */
147      protected EncoderSet buildDefault() {
148         return new EncoderSet(this);
149      }
150
151      /**
152       * Makes a copy of this builder.
153       *
154       * @return A new copy of this builder.
155       */
156      public Builder copy() {
157         return new Builder(this);
158      }
159
160      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
161      // Properties
162      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
163
164      /**
165       * Registers the specified encoders with this group.
166       *
167       * <p>
168       * Entries are added in-order to the beginning of the list.
169       *
170       * @param values The encoders to add to this group.
171       * @return This object.
172       * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any class does not extend from {@link Encoder}.
173       */
174      public Builder add(Class<?>...values) {
175         List<Object> l = Utils.list();
176         for (Class<?> v : values)
177            if (v.getSimpleName().equals("NoInherit"))
178               clear();
179         for (Class<?> v : values) {
180            if (Encoder.class.isAssignableFrom(v)) {
181               l.add(v);
182            } else if (! v.getSimpleName().equals("NoInherit")) {
183               throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid type passed to EncoderSet.Builder.add(): " + v.getName());
184            }
185         }
186         entries.addAll(0, l);
187         return this;
188      }
189
190      /**
191       * Sets the encoders in this group.
192       *
193       * <p>
194       * All encoders in this group are replaced with the specified values.
195       *
196       * <p>
197       * If {@link Inherit} is specified (or any other class whose simple name is <js>"Inherit"</js>, the existing values are preserved
198       * and inserted into the position in the values array.
199       *
200       * @param values The encoders to add to this group.
201       * @return This object.
202       * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any class does not extend from {@link Encoder}.
203       */
204      public Builder set(Class<?>...values) {
205         List<Object> l = Utils.list();
206         for (Class<?> v : values) {
207            if (v.getSimpleName().equals("Inherit")) {
208               l.addAll(entries);
209            } else if (Encoder.class.isAssignableFrom(v)) {
210               l.add(v);
211            } else {
212               throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid type passed to EncoderSet.Builder.set(): " + v.getName());
213            }
214         }
215         entries = l;
216         return this;
217      }
218
219      /**
220       * Registers the specified encoders with this group.
221       *
222       * <p>
223       * Entries are added to the beginning of the list.
224       *
225       * @param values The encoders to add to this group.
226       * @return This object.
227       */
228      public Builder add(Encoder...values) {
229         prependAll(entries, (Object[])values);
230         return this;
231      }
232
233      /**
234       * Clears out any existing encoders in this group.
235       *
236       * @return This object.
237       */
238      public Builder clear() {
239         entries.clear();
240         return this;
241      }
242
243      /**
244       * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this builder is empty.
245       *
246       * @return <jk>true</jk> if this builder is empty.
247       */
248      public boolean isEmpty() {
249         return entries.isEmpty();
250      }
251
252      /**
253       * Returns direct access to the {@link Encoder} objects and classes in this builder.
254       *
255       * <p>
256       * Provided to allow for any extraneous modifications to the list not accomplishable via other methods on this builder such
257       * as re-ordering/adding/removing entries.
258       *
259       * <p>
260       * Note that it is up to the user to ensure that the list only contains {@link Encoder} objects and classes.
261       *
262       * @return The inner list of entries in this builder.
263       */
264      public List<Object> inner() {
265         return entries;
266      }
267
268      // <FluentSetters>
269
270      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
271      public Builder impl(Object value) {
272         super.impl(value);
273         return this;
274      }
275
276      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanBuilder */
277      public Builder type(Class<?> value) {
278         super.type(value);
279         return this;
280      }
281
282      // </FluentSetters>
283
284      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
285      // Other methods
286      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
287
288      @Override /* Object */
289      public String toString() {
290         return entries.stream().map(Builder::toString).collect(joining(",","[","]"));
291      }
292
293      private static String toString(Object o) {
294         if (o == null)
295            return "null";
296         if (o instanceof Class)
297            return "class:" + ((Class<?>)o).getSimpleName();
298         return "object:" + o.getClass().getSimpleName();
299      }
300   }
301
302   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
303   // Instance
304   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
305
306   // Maps Accept-Encoding headers to matching encoders.
307   private final ConcurrentHashMap<String,EncoderMatch> cache = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
308
309   private final List<String> encodings;
310   private final Encoder[] encodingsEncoders;
311   private final Encoder[] entries;
312
313   /**
314    * Constructor.
315    *
316    * @param builder The builder for this object.
317    */
318   protected EncoderSet(Builder builder) {
319      entries = builder.entries.stream().map(x -> instantiate(builder.beanStore(), x)).toArray(Encoder[]::new);
320
321      List<String> lc = Utils.list();
322      List<Encoder> l = Utils.list();
323      for (Encoder e : entries) {
324         for (String c: e.getCodings()) {
325            lc.add(c);
326            l.add(e);
327         }
328      }
329
330      this.encodings = u(lc);
331      this.encodingsEncoders = l.toArray(new Encoder[l.size()]);
332   }
333
334   private static Encoder instantiate(BeanStore bs, Object o) {
335      if (o instanceof Encoder)
336         return (Encoder)o;
337      try {
338         return bs.createBean(Encoder.class).type((Class<?>)o).run();
339      } catch (ExecutableException e) {
340         throw asRuntimeException(e);
341      }
342   }
343
344   /**
345    * Returns the coding string for the matching encoder that can handle the specified <c>Accept-Encoding</c>
346    * or <c>Content-Encoding</c> header value.
347    *
348    * <p>
349    * Returns <jk>null</jk> if no encoders can handle it.
350    *
351    * <p>
352    * This method is fully compliant with the RFC2616/14.3 and 14.11 specifications.
353    *
354    * @param acceptEncoding The <c>Accept-Encoding</c> or <c>Content-Encoding</c> value.
355    * @return The coding value (e.g. <js>"gzip"</js>).
356    */
357   public EncoderMatch getEncoderMatch(String acceptEncoding) {
358      EncoderMatch em = cache.get(acceptEncoding);
359      if (em != null)
360         return em;
361
362      StringRanges ae = StringRanges.of(acceptEncoding);
363      int match = ae.match(encodings);
364
365      if (match >= 0) {
366         em = new EncoderMatch(encodings.get(match), encodingsEncoders[match]);
367         cache.putIfAbsent(acceptEncoding, em);
368      }
369
370      return cache.get(acceptEncoding);
371   }
372
373   /**
374    * Returns the encoder registered with the specified coding (e.g. <js>"gzip"</js>).
375    *
376    * @param encoding The coding string.
377    * @return The encoder, or <jk>null</jk> if encoder isn't registered with that coding.
378    */
379   public Encoder getEncoder(String encoding) {
380      EncoderMatch em = getEncoderMatch(encoding);
381      return (em == null ? null : em.getEncoder());
382   }
383
384   /**
385    * Returns the set of codings supported by all encoders in this group.
386    *
387    * @return An unmodifiable list of codings supported by all encoders in this group.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
388    */
389   public List<String> getSupportedEncodings() {
390      return encodings;
391   }
392}
